text: Jules Mutebusi (c. 1960 - 9 May 2014) was a Congolese military person. He was a former rebel leader. He has been often described as a Rwandan proxy. Mutebusi was captured in 2004 and was put on trial for treason. He was soon sentenced to exile. He remained in exile until he died in 2014. Mutebusi died in a Kigali hospital from an illness, aged 54. ==References== Category:1960s births Category:2014 deaths Category:African military people Category:Democratic Republic of the Congo people
title: Jules Mutebusi
